result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alan Eduardo San Hernandez

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Alan Eduardo San Hernandez in court.  Attorney John Stephen Joyce in court for Alan Eduardo San Hernandez.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for motion hearing on Defense Motion to Suppress Evidence.  Motion hearing proceeded. 
Sworn for state: P.O. Daniel Gitzlaff. 
Testimony closed. Closing arguments. 

Based on statements put forth by Court and parties, Court GRANTS Defense motion. Case adjourned for status conference. Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 37, Judge Dee in Room 515 of the Courthouse.
Status conference scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
In Support of Defense's Motion to Suppress Evidence Derived from Unlawful Search of Defendant's Vehicle, filed.
AMENDED, to Suppress Evidence Derived From Unlawful Search of Defendant's Vehicle, filed.
to Suppress Evidence Derived from Unlawful Search of Defendant's Vehicle, Defense, filed.

Defendant Alan Eduardo San Hernandez in court with attorney John Stephen Joyce.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Alan Eduardo San Hernandez appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defense counsel has received discovery and requests additional time to review. Defense counsel informed the Court that an offer has not been received.  Defense requested a motion hearing date. Court ordered case adjourned for motion hearing in Branch 37. Defense motion to be filed by 7/29/2022. Any State's response to be filed by 9/22/2022. All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Motion hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Court ordered no possession or use of any no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Alan Eduardo San Hernandez in court with attorney John Stephen Joyce.  Claire Louise Starling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 046622,
Payable Number: 1006746,
Receipt Number: 22RP019651,
Amount: $20.00
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/17/2022@2:30PM
